Detailed Description

PWM driver for the TMS570LC43xx.

Author
foxBMS Team
Date
2021-10-07 (date of creation)
Updated
2023-02-03 (date of last update)
Version
v1.5.0
Prefix
PWM

This module uses the PWM hardware of the MCU in order to generate a PWM signal. Currently, the implementation uses only the ePWM (not the HET) and supports only setting a duty cycle (in percent). For the module to work currently, the function etpwmInit() has to be called before using API of this module.

Definition in file pwm.h.

◆ PWM_SetDutyCycle()

void PWM_SetDutyCycle ( uint16_t  dutyCycle_perm)

Set the duty cycle of the PWM (currently only channel 1A)

Duty cycle values that are out of the range that is supported are limited to the threshold values.

Parameters
[in]dutyCycle_permduty cycle in permill

◆ PWM_StartPwm()

void PWM_StartPwm ( void  )

Start the PWM (starts all configured ePWM channels)

In order for this function to work, it is absolutely necessary that etpwmInit() is called first.

Definition at line 135 of file pwm.c.
